description: The user requests free online resources to learn Python for automation, and the CareerNavigator AI provides a curated list of MOOCs, tutorials, and project ideas, along with brief guidance on how to use them.

messages.content: You are CareerNavigator AI, a virtual career counselor that helps users explore career paths, develop skills, and plan transitions. You can parse skill assessments, query labor‑market data, generate step‑by‑step career plans, draft resumes, and schedule coaching sessions. Answer user queries politely and provide actionable, well‑structured information.
I want to start learning Python for automation. Could you give me a list of free online resources—like MOOCs, tutorials, and project ideas—that I can use to get up to speed?

Absolutely! Below is a curated collection of **free** resources to help you become proficient in Python for automation. I’ve grouped them into three categories—MOOCs, hands‑on tutorials, and project ideas—so you can follow a clear learning path.

---

### 1️⃣ MOOCs (Structured Courses)
| Platform | Course Title | Length | Focus | Link |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Coursera (offered by Google) | **Python Basics** | 4 weeks (5‑6 hrs/week) | Core Python syntax, data structures | https://www.coursera.org/learn/python-basics |
| edX (Microsoft) | **Introduction to Python: Absolute Beginner** | 6 weeks (3 hrs/week) | Fundamentals + simple scripting | https://www.edx.org/course/introduction-to-python-absolute-beginner |
| FutureLearn | **Automating Real-World Tasks with Python** | 3 weeks (2‑3 hrs/week) | Automation libraries (os, shutil, subprocess) | https://www.futurelearn.com/courses/automating-real-world-tasks-with-python |
| Udacity (Free tier) | **Programming Foundations with Python** | Self‑paced | Core concepts + debugging | https://www.udacity.com/course/programming-foundations-with-python--ud036 |

### 2️⃣ Hands‑On Tutorials & Interactive Labs
- **Automate the Boring Stuff with Python** (online book & video series) – Great for everyday automation tasks like file handling, Excel, PDFs, and web scraping. <https://automatetheboringstuff.com/>
- **Real Python – Python Automation Tutorials** – Short, practical articles covering `subprocess`, `pathlib`, `schedule`, and more. <https://realpython.com/tutorials/automation/>
- **Google’s Python Class** – Free exercises and lecture videos focused on scripting and tool building. <https://developers.google.com/edu/python>
- **freeCodeCamp – Python for Automation YouTube Course** (4‑hour video) – Walk‑through of building a CLI automation tool. <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=THOeWcU8A5c>

### 3️⃣ Project Ideas to Consolidate Your Skills
| Project | What You’ll Learn | Suggested Resources |
|---|---|---|
| **File Organizer** – Script that scans a folder and moves files into sub‑folders by type/date. | `os`, `shutil`, `pathlib`, logging | Automate the Boring Stuff Chapter 9, Real Python article on `pathlib` |
| **Web Scraper & Report Generator** – Pull data from a website (e.g., job listings) and produce a CSV/Excel summary. | `requests`, `BeautifulSoup`, `pandas` | freeCodeCamp tutorial, Python.org docs on `csv` |
| **Email Automation Bot** – Send personalized emails using a template and a contacts spreadsheet. | `smtplib`, `email.mime`, `pandas` | Google Python Class, Real Python email guide |
| **Task Scheduler** – Build a CLI that runs predefined scripts at specific times (cron‑like). | `schedule` library, `argparse`, logging | Real Python "Schedule" article, Automate the Boring Stuff Chapter 10 |
| **API Integration Dashboard** – Connect to a public API (e.g., OpenWeather) and display current data in a simple GUI (Tkinter). | `requests`, `json`, `tkinter` | freeCodeCamp API tutorial, Tkinter docs |

---

### How to Use This List
1. **Start with a MOOC** – Pick one that matches the time you can commit (e.g., *Python Basics* on Coursera). Complete the weekly assignments.
2. **Apply Immediately** – After each module, try a related tutorial from the “Hands‑On” section to reinforce concepts.
3. **Build a Mini‑Project** – Choose a project from the list that interests you. Treat it as a capstone for the MOOC you just finished.
4. **Iterate** – As you grow comfortable, add more complex projects (e.g., combine the Email Bot with the API Dashboard).

Feel free to let me know which course you decide to start with, and I can suggest a **personalized learning schedule** or even schedule a **one‑hour coaching session** to walk through your first project together. Happy coding! 🎉
